1.1: Revelation of Jesus Christ, which God gave to him, show to his servants what he sees happening in the future, and the sign you sent by his angel to his servant John,
1.2: who testified the word of God and the testimony of Jesus Christ, what he saw.
1.3: blessed is he who hears and hears the words of the prophecy and keeps what is written in it, for the time is near.
1.4: John to the seven churches in Asia: grace to you and peace from Him who was and who is to come, and from the seven spirits before his throne,
1.5: and from Jesus Christ, the faithful witness, the firstborn of the dead and the prince of the kings of the earth.  To him who loved us and redeemed us from our sins in his blood
1.6: and make us a kingdom, priests to God and his father, to him be the glory and the kingdom for ever and ever; amen.
1.7: Behold, he is coming with the clouds, and every eye will see him and those who excommunicated him, and all the tribes of the earth will be cut off against him.  yes, amen.
1.8: I am the Alpha and the Lord, says the Lord God, the One who was and the One who is to come, the Almighty.
1.9: I John, your brother and companion in tribulation and kingdom and patience in Jesus, was living on the island called Patmos because of the word of God and the testimony of Jesus.
1.10: I was in the spirit on Sunday, and I heard behind me a voice as loud as a trumpet
1.11: speaking, you see written in a book and five in the seven churches, in Ephesus and in Smyrna and in Pergamon and in Thyatira and in Sardis and in Philadelphia and in Laodicea.
1.12: And I returned and saw the voice that spoke with me; and when I returned I saw seven golden lamps,
1.13: and in the midst of the lamps a like son of man, clothed with loincloths, and girded about the breasts with a golden girdle;
1.14: and his head and hair were white as a white lion, as white as a lamb, and his eyes were like a flame of fire,
1.15: and his feet like bronze, as if burned in a furnace, and his voice as the voice of many waters,
1.16: and he has in his right hand seven stars, and from his mouth a sharp double-mouthed sword emanating, and his face like the sun shines in his power.
1.17: And when I saw him, I fell at his feet as dead; and he laid his right hand upon me, saying, Fear not: I am the first and the last.
1.18: and I was alive, and I was dead, and behold, I am alive forever and ever, and I have the keys of death and hell.
1.19: write then what you have seen and what has happened and what will happen after this.
1.20: the mystery of the seven stars which you saw on my right hand, and the seven golden lamps; the seven stars are the angels of the seven churches, and the seven lamps are the seven churches.

2.1: To the angel of the church in Ephesus write: Thus saith he that holdeth the seven stars in his right hand, he that walketh in the midst of the seven golden lamps;
2.2: I saw your works and your labor and your patience, and that you cannot endure the wicked, and you tried them calling themselves apostles and they are not, and you found them liars.
2.3: and you have patience, and you have endured for my name's sake, and you have not grown weary.
2.4: but I have it against you that you left your first love.
2.5: remember then from whence thou camest, and repent, and write the first works; but if not, I will come to thee and remove thy lamp from its place, if thou repent not.
2.6: but this is what you have, because you hate the works of the Nicolaitans, which I also hate.
2.7: Let him who is here hear what the spirit says to the churches.  to the overcomer I will give him to eat from the tree of life, which is in the paradise of God.
2.8: And to the angel of the church in Smyrna write: Thus says the first and the last, who was born dead and lived;
2.9: He sees your sorrow and poverty, but you are rich, and the blasphemy from those who say Jews are themselves, and are nothing but the synagogue of Satan.
2.10: don't be afraid of the future suffering.  Behold, the devil is about to throw some of you into prison to tempt you, and you will have ten days of tribulation.  be faithful unto death, and I will give you the crown of life.
2.11: Let him who is here hear what the spirit says to the churches.  the victor will not be wronged by the death of the second.
2.12: And to the angel of the church in Pergamum write: Thus saith he that hath the trumpet, the double-edged sword;
2.13: I saw where you dwell, where the throne of Satan, and you keep my name, and I will not deny my faith, and in the days of Antipas, my witness, my believer, who spread out among you, where Satan dwells.
2.14: but I have little against you, because you are there holding the doctrine of Balaam, which you taught to Balak to cause scandal before the children of Israel, to eat idolatrous things and to commit fornication;
2.15: so have you, keeping the teaching of [the] Nicolaitans likewise.
2.16: Repent then, but if not, I will come to you quickly, and I will fight with them with the sword of my mouth.
2.17: Let him who is here hear what the spirit says to the churches.  to the victor I will give him the hidden manna, and I will give him a white vote and on the vote a new name written which no one has seen except the recipient.
2.18: And to the angel of the church in Thyateira write: Thus saith the son of God, who hath his eyes as a flame of fire, and his feet like unto bronze;
2.19: I see your works and your love and your faith and your ministry and your patience, and your last works are more than the first ones.
2.20: but I have it against you that you let the woman Jezebel, who called herself a prophetess, and teaches and misleads our servants to fornicate and eat idolatrous things.
2.21: And I gave her time to repent, and she will not repent of her fornication.
2.22: behold, I put her in bed, and those committing adultery with her in great sorrow, if they do not repent of her works;
2.23: and her children I will take away in death; and all the churches will know that I am the searcher of kidneys and hearts, and I will give to each of you according to your works.
2.24: But to you I say to the rest of those in Thyateira, who do not have this doctrine, who have not known the depths of Satan, as they say, I do not lay any other burden on you;
2.25: except what you have, keep it free where I can go.
2.26: And he that overcometh, and he that keepeth my works to the end, to him will I give power over the nations,
2.27: and he shepherds them with a rod of iron, as the pottery is broken,
2.28: just as I drank from my father, and I will give him the morning star.
2.29: Let him who is here hear what the spirit says to the churches.

3.1: And to the angel of the church in Sardis write: Thus says he who has the seven spirits of God and the seven stars: He sees your works, because you have a name because you live, and you are dead.
3.2: be quick, and support the rest that will die, for your works are not fulfilled before my god;
3.3: remember then how you have received and heard, and keep, and repent.  If then you do not make haste, I will come like a thief, and I do not know at what hour I will come upon you.
3.4: but you have few names in Sardis who have not defiled their garments, and they will walk with me in white, for they are worthy.
3.5: the victor is thus surrounded in white robes, and I will not blot out his name from the book of life, and I will confess his name before my father and before his angels.
3.6: Let him who is here hear what the spirit says to the churches.
3.7: And to the angel of the church in Philadelphia write: Thus says the holy one, the true one, who has the key of David, who opens and no one closes, and he closes and no one opens;
3.8: I have seen your works, behold, I have set before you a newly opened door, which no one can close because you have little power, and you keep my word, and I will not deny my name.
3.9: Behold, I bring forth from the synagogue of Satan, those who say they are Jews, and are not, but lie; behold, I will make them bow down and worship before your feet, and know that I love you.
3.10: because you have kept the word of my patience, I will keep you from the time of temptation that will come upon the whole world and tempt those who dwell on the earth.
3.11: I come quickly; keep what you have, so that no one will receive your crown.
3.12: the victor will make this pillar in the temple of my God, and no year shall come out, and I will write on it the name of my God and the name of the city of my God, the new Jerusalem, which is coming down from heaven from my God, and my new name.
3.13: Let him who is here hear what the spirit says to the churches.
3.14: And to the angel of the church in Laodicea write: Thus saith the Amen, the faithful and true witness, the beginning of the creation of God;
3.15: I see your works, because you are neither cold nor hot.  were you cold or warm?
3.16: thus, because you are lukewarm and neither hot nor cold, I will eat you from my mouth.
3.17: because you say that I am rich and I have become rich and I have no need, and you did not see that you are the suffering and the pitiful and the poor and the blind and the naked,
3.18: I advise you to buy from me gold refined from fire so that you will become rich, and white clothes so that your nakedness may not be seen, and you anoint your eyes with ointment so that you can see.
3.19: I control and chastise those whom I kiss: be jealous, then, and repent.
3.20: Behold, I stand at the door and knock; if he hears my voice and opens the door, [and] I will come in to him and dine with him and he with me.
3.21: to him that overcometh I will give you to sit with me on my throne, as I also conquered and sat with my father on his throne.
3.22: Let him who is here hear what the spirit says to the churches.

4.1: After these things I saw, and behold a door opened in heaven, and the first voice that I heard as a trumpet speaking with me saying, Come up here, and I will show you what will happen after these things.
4.2: straightway I was in the spirit: and behold, a throne was in heaven, and one sitting on the throne,
4.3: and the one sitting like that saw a stone of jasper and sardius, and from around the throne one saw like an emerald.
4.4: and around the throne there were twenty-four thrones, and on the thrones twenty-four elders seated, clothed in white robes, and on their heads golden crowns.
4.5: and from the throne proceed lightnings and voices and thunders; and seven lamps of fire burn before the throne, which are the seven spirits of God,
4.6: and before the throne like a clear sea like crystal.  And in the middle of the throne and around the throne four beasts full of eyes in front and behind;
4.7: And the first beast like a lion, and the second beast like a calf, and the third beast has the face of a man, and the fourth beast like a flying eagle.
4.8: and the four beasts, each one of them having six wings, are filled with eyes from all around and from within; and they have no rest day or night, saying, Holy, holy, holy, Lord, God Almighty, who was and who is and who is to come.
4.9: And when the living creatures give glory and honor and thanksgiving to him who sits on the throne, to the living forever and ever,
4.10: the twenty-four elders fall down before him who sits on the throne and worship the living one forever and ever, and they put their crowns before the throne saying,
4.11: You are worthy, our Lord and God, receive the glory and the honor and the power, because you created all things, and by your will they were and were created.

5.1: And I saw on the right hand of him who sat on the throne a book written inside and on the back, sealed with seven seals.
5.2: And I saw a mighty angel proclaiming with a loud voice, Whose is worthy to open the book and loose its seals?
5.3: and it was not possible for anyone in heaven, nor on earth, nor under the earth to open the book, nor to see it.
5.4: And I weep a lot because no one was found worthy to open the book or see it.
5.5: And one of the elders says to me, "Don't cry. Behold, the lion of the tribe of Judah, the root of David, has conquered, open the book and its seven seals."
5.6: And I saw in the midst of the throne and the four beasts and in the midst of the elders a lamb standing as if it had been slain, having seven horns and seven eyes, which are the [seven] spirits of God sent forth into all the earth.
5.7: And they came and received from the right hand of him who sat on the throne.
5.8: and when he received the book, the four beasts and the twenty-four elders fell down before the lamb, each having a guitar and golden flasks full of incense, for the prayers of the saints.
5.9: And they shall sing again, saying, Worthy are you to take the book and open its seals, for you have slain and bought for God with your blood every kindred and tongue and people and nation.
5.10: And you made them a kingdom and priests to our god, and they reign on the earth.
5.11: And I saw and heard the voice of many angels around the throne and the living creatures and the elders, and their number was myriads of myriads and thousands of thousands,
5.12: saying with a loud voice, Worthy is the lamb that was slain, let them receive power and riches and wisdom and power and honor and glory and blessing.
5.13: and every building that is in heaven and on earth and under the earth and on the sea, and everything in them, I heard saying, To Him who sits on the throne and to the Lamb be the blessing and the honor and the glory and the kingdom forever and ever.
5.14: And the four beasts said, Amen, and the elders fell down and prostrated themselves.

6.1: And I saw when the lamb opened one of the seven seals, and I heard one of the four beasts saying like a voice of thunder, Come.
6.2: And I looked, and behold, a white horse, and he who sat on it had a bow, and a crown was given to him, and he went out victorious and to conquer.
6.3: And when he opened the second seal, I heard the second living being say, Come.
6.4: And another pyrrhic horse came out, and to the one sitting on it it was given to him to take peace from the earth and to slay each other, and a great knife was given to him.
6.5: And when he opened the third seal, I heard the third living being say, Come.  And I looked, and there was a horse, and he who sat on it had a yoke in his hand.
6.6: and I heard as a voice in the midst of the four beasts saying, A sheaf of wheat worth a denarius, and three sheaves of barley worth a denarius: and the oil and the wine thou shalt not do wrong.
6.7: And when he opened the fourth seal, I heard the voice of the fourth creature saying, Come.
6.8: And I looked, and behold, a white horse, and he who sat on him was called Death, and Hendus followed with him, and power was given to them over the fourth part of the earth, and they were possessed in famine and in famine and in death and under the beasts of the earth.
6.9: And when he opened the fifth seal, I saw under the altar the souls of those who had been slaughtered for the word of God and for the testimony they had.
6.10: and they cried out with a loud voice, saying, How long, O holy and true despot, will you not judge and avenge our blood from those who dwell on the earth?
6.11: And they were each given a white uniform, and it was ordered for them to rest for a short time each year, until their consorts were paid and their brothers who were to come were dispossessed like them.
6.12: And I saw when he opened the sixth seal, and there was a great earthquake, and the sun immediately became like a sack of hair, and the whole moon became like blood,
6.13: and the stars of heaven fell to the earth, as a fig tree casts its branches under a great stormy wind,
6.14: And the sky was separated like a moving book, and every mountain and island were moved from their places.
6.15: and the kings of the earth and the great men and the centurions and the rich and the strong and every slave and free hid themselves in the caves and in the rocks of the mountains;
6.16: And they say to the stones and to the stones, Fall on us and hide us from the face of Him who sits on the throne and from the wrath of the Lamb.
6.17: for the great day of their wrath has come, and who can stand it?

7.1: After this I saw four angels standing at the four corners of the earth, holding the four winds of the earth, so that no wind would blow on the earth, nor on the sea, nor on any tree.
7.2: And I saw another angel ascending from the rising sun, having the seal of the living God, and he cried with a loud voice to the four angels, to whom it was given to destroy the earth and the sea,
7.3: saying, Do not wrong the earth nor the sea nor the trees until we seal the servants of our god on their foreheads.
7.4: and I heard the number of those who were sealed, a hundred and forty-four thousand, sealed from every tribe of the children of Israel.
7.5: from the tribe of Judah twelve thousand sealed, from the tribe of Reuben twelve thousand, from the tribe of Gad twelve thousand,
7.6: from the tribe of Asher twelve thousand, from the tribe of Naphtali twelve thousand, from the tribe of Manasseh twelve thousand,
7.7: from the tribe of Simeon twelve thousand, from the tribe of Levi twelve thousand, from the tribe of Issachar twelve thousand,
7.8: from the tribe of Zebulun twelve thousand, from the tribe of Joseph twelve thousand, from the tribe of Benjamin twelve thousand sealed.
7.9: After these things I saw, and behold a great multitude, which you could not number, from all nations and tribes and peoples and languages, standing before the throne and before the lamb, clothed in white garments, and palm trees in their hands;
7.10: and they cry out with a loud voice, saying, Salvation to our God who sits on the throne and to the Lamb.
7.11: and all the angels stood around the throne and the elders and the four living creatures, and they fell on their faces before the throne and worshiped God,
7.12: saying, Amen; to our God be the blessing, and the glory, and the wisdom, and the thanksgiving, and the power, and the power, for ever and ever; Amen.
7.13: And one of the elders answered me, saying, Who are these dressed in white robes and where did they come from?
7.14: And I said to him, My Lord, you have seen.  and he said to me, These are the ones coming out of the great tribulation, and they washed their robes and made them white in the blood of the lamb.
7.15: therefore they are before the throne of God, and they worship him day and night in his temple, and he who sits on the throne dwells over them.
7.16: they shall not hunger, nor thirst, neither shall the sun fall upon them, nor any heat,
7.17: for the lamb that is in the midst of the throne shall shepherd them, and shall lead them unto living springs of water: and God shall wipe away every tear from their eyes.

8.1: And when he opened the seal on the seventh day, there was silence in heaven like half an hour.
8.2: And I saw the seven angels who stood before God, and seven trumpets were given to them.
8.3: And another angel came and stood on the altar of golden incense, and much incense was given to him to offer the prayers of all the saints on the golden altar before the throne.
8.4: And the smoke of the incense of the prayers of the saints rose from the hand of the angel before God.
8.5: And the angel took the censer, and filled it from the fire of the altar, and put it on the earth, and there were thunders and voices and lightnings and an earthquake.
8.6: And the seven angels having the seven trumpets prepared them to blow the trumpets.
8.7: And the first one blew his trumpet, and there was fire and fire mixed with blood, and it fell to the earth, and a third of the earth was destroyed, and a third of the trees were destroyed, and all green grass was destroyed.
8.8: And the second angel blew his trumpet, and like a great mountain burning with fire, it was thrown into the sea, and the third blood of the sea was born,
8.9: And a third of the buildings in the sea died, those that had souls, and a third of the ships were corrupted.
8.10: And the third angel blew his trumpet, and there fell from heaven a great star burning like a lamp, and it fell on the third of the rivers and on the fountains of waters.
8.11: and the name of the star is Absinthe.  And the third of the waters was turned into wormwood, and many of the people died from the waters, because they were overcome.
8.12: And the fourth angel blew his trumpet, and smote the third of the sun, and the third of the moon, and the third of the stars, so that the third of them was darkened, and the day did not see its third, and the night likewise.
8.13: And I saw, and I heard an eagle flying in midair saying with a loud voice, Oh, oh, oh, oh, to those who dwell on the earth from the other voices of the trumpet of the three angels of the future.

9.1: And the fifth angel blew his trumpet, and I saw a star from heaven descending to the earth, and the key to the well of the abyss was given to him.
9.2: And he opened the well of the abyss, and smoke rose from the well like the smoke of a great furnace, and the sun and the air were extinguished from the smoke of the well.
9.3: And locusts came out of the smoke to the earth, and power was given to them as the scorpions of the earth have power.
9.4: and he urged them not to wrong the grass of the earth, nor any green thing, nor any tree, but the people who do not have the seal of God on their foreheads.
9.5: And it was given to them that they should not be taken away, but that they should be tormented for five months, and their torment would be like the torment of a scorpion when it preys on a human being.
9.6: And in those days men shall seek death and shall not find it, and shall desire to die, and death shall depart from them.
9.7: And the images of the locusts were like horses prepared for war, and on their heads like crowns like gold, and their faces like the faces of men,
9.8: and they had hair like women's hair, and their teeth were like lions,
9.9: And they had breastplates like iron breastplates, and the sound of their wings was like the sound of chariots of many horses running to war.
9.10: and they have a sky like scorpions and centers, and in their skies their power is unjust to men for five months.
9.11: they have as king over them the angel of the abyss; his name in Hebrew is Abaddon, and in Greek his name is Apollyon.
9.12: One God was sent; behold, two Gods are coming after this.
9.13: And the sixth angel blew his trumpet, and I heard a voice from one of the [four] horns of the golden altar before God,
9.14: saying to the sixth angel, who has the trumpet, Loose the four angels who are bound on the great river Euphrates.
9.15: And the four angels were released, prepared for the hour and day and month and themselves, to take away the third part of the people.
9.16: and the number of the horsemen's troops are billions of myriads: I have heard the number of them.
9.17: and thus I saw the horses in the vision and those who sat on them, having in their breastplates fire and jacinth and sulphur; and the heads of the horses like the heads of lions, and from their mouths issuing forth fire and smoke and sulphur.
9.18: from these three plagues sprang the third of men, from the fire and the smoke and the brimstone that issued from their mouths.
9.19: for the power of the horses is in their mouths, and in their eyes; for their eyes are like unto them, thou hast a head, and in them they are unjust.
9.20: And the rest of men, who did not perish in the same plagues, did not repent of the works of their hands, so that they would not worship demons and idols of gold and silver and copper and stone and wood, which they neither see nor hear nor hear. walk,
9.21: and they did not repent of their murders, nor of their medicines, nor of their fornication, nor of their thefts.

10.1: And I saw another mighty angel coming down from heaven, covered with a cloud, and the iris on his head, and his face like the sun, and his feet like pillars of fire,
10.2: and I have in his hand a new book.  And he set his right foot on the sea, and his left foot on the ground,
10.3: And he shouted with a loud voice like a roaring lion.  and when he cried, the seven thunders spoke their voices.
10.4: And when the seven thunders spoke, they were about to write; and I heard a voice from heaven saying, Seal up what the seven thunders spoke, and do not write it.
10.5: And the angel whom I saw on the sea and on the land had his right hand toward heaven
10.6: And he lived forever and ever, who made the heavens and the things in them and the earth and the things in them and the sea and the things in them, for time is nothing,
10.7: but in the days of the voice of the seventh angel, when the trumpet came, and the mystery of God was fulfilled, as he evangelized his servants the prophets.
10.8: And the voice that I heard from heaven, again they spoke to me and said, Take the book that was opened in the hand of the angel of the sea and on the earth.
10.9: And I went to the angel saying to him, show me the book.  And he says to me, Take and eat this, and it will make your stomach bitter, but in your mouth it will be as sweet as honey.
10.10: And they took the scroll from the angel's hand and ate it, and it was in my mouth like sweet honey, and when they ate it, my stomach was upset.
10.11: and say to me, Behold, you prophesy again over many peoples and nations and languages ​​and kingdoms.

11.1: And there was given me a reed like a rod, saying, Lean and measure the temple of God and the altar and those who worship in it.
11.2: and the court that is outside the temple, put it outside and do not count it, because it was given to the nations, and they will trample the holy city for a month and four and two.
11.3: And I will give unto the evil ones my witness, and they shall prophesy a thousand and two hundred days, sixty covered sacks.
11.4: These are the two oils and the two lamps before the lord of the earth.
11.5: And if he wants to wrong them, fire comes out of their mouths and subdues their enemies; and if he wants to wrong them, then he will be destroyed.
11.6: These have the power to close the sky, so that it does not rain during the days of their prophecy, and they have power over the waters to turn them into blood and smite the earth in all plagues whenever they wish.
11.7: And when they have fulfilled their testimony, the beast that ascends from the abyss will make war with them and defeat them and take them away.
11.8: and their corpse in the square of the great city, which is spiritually called Sodom and Egypt, where their master was also crucified.
11.9: And from the peoples and tribes and tongues and nations they see their dead bodies for three and a half days, and their dead bodies are not buried.
11.10: And the inhabitants of the earth will rejoice over them and be glad, and they will give gifts to one another, because these two prophets tormented the inhabitants of the earth.
11.11: and after the three and a half days, the spirit of life from God entered into them, and they stood on their feet, and great fear fell on those who saw them.
11.12: and they heard a great voice from heaven saying to them, Come up here, and they ascended into heaven in a cloud, and their enemies saw them.
11.13: And at that time there was a great earthquake, and the tenth of the city fell, and in the earthquake the names of a thousand and seven people were scattered, and the rest were afraid and gave glory to the god of heaven.
11.14: The second God was sent; behold, the third God is coming quickly.
11.15: And the seventh angel blew his trumpet, and there were loud voices in heaven saying, The kingdom of the world of our Lord and of his Christ has come, and he will reign forever and ever.
11.16: and the twenty-four elders [who] sat before God on their thrones fell on their faces and worshiped God
11.17: saying, We give thanks to you, Lord God Almighty, who is and was, because you received your great power and reigned;
11.18: and the nations were enraged, and your wrath has come, and the time of the dead is judged, and you give the wages to your servants, to the prophets, and to the saints, and to those who fear your name, the small and the great, and you corrupt them by corrupting the earth.
11.19: And the temple of God in heaven was opened, and the ark of his covenant came into his temple, and there were lightnings, and voices, and thunders, and an earthquake, and great destruction.

12.1: And a great sign appeared in heaven, a woman clothed with the sun, and the moon under her feet, and on her head a crown of twelve stars,
12.2: And I had it in my stomach, and it cries out in pain and tormented.
12.3: And another sign appeared in the sky, and behold, a great pyrrhic dragon, having seven heads and ten horns, and on his heads seven diadems,
12.4: And his sky drew the third of the stars of the sky and put them on the earth.  And the dragon stood in front of the woman of the expectant mother, so that when she gave birth to her child, he would eat her.
12.5: And she gave birth to a son, a man, who will shepherd all the nations with a rod of iron, and her child was caught up to God and to his throne.
12.6: And the woman went away into the desert, where there is a place prepared by God, so that they would feed her there for one thousand two hundred and sixty days.
12.7: And there was war in heaven, Michael and his angels fighting with the dragon.  and the dragon fought and his angels,
12.8: And it didn't work, no place was found for them in heaven.
12.9: And the great dragon was cast, the ancient serpent, the one called the Devil and Satan, the one who deceives the whole world was cast down to the earth, and his angels were cast down with him.
12.10: and I heard a great voice in heaven saying, "For the salvation and the power and the kingdom of our God and the authority of his Christ have come, for the accuser of our brothers has been sent, who accuses them before our God day and night."
12.11: and they overcame him by the blood of the lamb and by the word of their testimony, and they did not love their souls unto death.
12.12: therefore rejoice, [the] heavens and those who dwell in them; O earth and sea, for the devil has come down to you, having great anger, seeing that he has but a short time.
12.13: And when the dragon saw that he was cast into the earth, he pursued the woman who gave birth to the man.
12.14: and the two wings of the great eagle were given to the woman, so that she may fly into the desert to her place, where she feeds there time and time and half a time from the face of the sun.
12.15: And the serpent poured out of his mouth behind the woman water like a river, to make her a river bearer.
12.16: And the earth helped the woman, and the earth opened her mouth and swallowed the river that the dragon put out of his mouth.
12.17: and the dragon was angry with the woman, and went out to make war with the rest of her seed, those who keep the commandments of God and have the testimony of Jesus.

13.1: And I saw a beast rising out of the sea, having ten horns and seven heads, and on his horns ten diadems, and on his heads names of blasphemy.
13.2: And the beast that I saw was like a lion, and his feet were like a bow, and his mouth was like the mouth of a lion.  And the dragon gave him his power and his throne and great authority.
13.3: and one of his heads as if it had been slaughtered to death, and the wound of his death was healed.  and all the earth marveled behind the beast,
13.4: and they worshiped the dragon because he gave power to the beast, and they worshiped the beast saying, You are like a beast, and what can you do with him?
13.5: And he was given a mouth speaking great and blasphemous words, and he was given power to make a month four and two.
13.6: And he opened his mouth in blasphemy against God, blaspheming his name and his tabernacle, those who are tabernacled in heaven.
13.7: And it was given to him to make war with the saints and to defeat them, and he was given authority over every tribe and people and language and nation.
13.8: and let all the inhabitants of the earth worship him, where his name is not written in the book of life of the lamb that was slain at the slaying of the world.
13.9: If he has them, let me hear them.
13.10: If they are in captivity, in captivity he falls; if they are killed by a knife, he is killed by a knife.  Neither is the patience and faith of the saints.
13.11: And I saw another beast coming up from the earth, and it had two horns like a lamb, and it roared like a dragon.
13.12: and the power of the first beast everyone bows before him.  and he makes the earth and those who dwell in it to worship the first beast, by which the wound of his death was healed.
13.13: And he makes great signs, so that fire comes down from heaven to the earth in the presence of men.
13.14: And he misleads those who dwell on the earth by the signs given to him to be before the beast, saying to those who dwell on the earth that you are an image to the beast that has the wound of the knife and lived.
13.15: And it was given to him to give spirit to the image of the beast, so that the image of the beast would speak and do [so that] those who do not worship the image of the beast will be destroyed.
13.16: and compels everyone, the small and the great, and the rich and the poor, and the free and the slave, to give them a mark on their right hand or on their forehead,
13.17: And so that you cannot buy or sell them unless you have the mark, the name of the beast or the number of his name.
13.18: Here is wisdom, let him who has wisdom vote the number of the beast, for it is the number of a man, and his number is six hundred and sixty-six.

14.1: And I looked, and behold, the lamb is on Mount Zion, and with him a hundred and forty-four thousand have his name and his father's name written on their foreheads.
14.2: and I heard a voice from heaven as the voice of many waters and as the voice of great thunder, and the voice I heard as of guitar players playing on their guitars.
14.3: And they will wear a new robe before the throne and before the four living creatures and the elders; and no one could learn the robe except the one hundred and forty-four thousand, who were bought from the earth.
14.4: these are those who have been with women and have not been defiled, for they are virgins.  these are the ones who follow the lamb wherever he goes.  These were bought from men from the beginning to God and to the Lamb,
14.5: and in their mouths no lie was found; they are clean.
14.6: And I saw another angel flying in midair, having everlasting gospel to preach to those who dwell on the earth and to every nation and tribe and tongue and people,
14.7: saying in a loud voice, Fear God and give him glory, for the hour of his judgment has come, and worship him who made heaven and earth and sea and springs of water.
14.8: And another second angel followed, saying, Fallen, fallen Babylon the great, which from the wine of the wrath of her fornication has deluged all the nations.
14.9: And another third angel followed them, saying in a loud voice, "Whether the beast worships them and his image, and receives a mark on his forehead or on his hand,
14.10: and he will drink of the wine of the wrath of God, the glorious one, in the cup of his wrath, and will be tormented in fire and sulfur in the presence of holy angels and in the presence of the lamb.
14.11: And the smoke of their torment rises for ever and ever, and they will have no rest day and night, those who worship the beast and his image, and whether the engraving of his name receives them.
14.12: Here is the patience of the saints, those who keep the commandments of God and the faith of Jesus.
14.13: And I heard a voice from heaven saying, Write: Blessed are the dead who perish in the Lord.  yes, says the spirit, that they may rest from their labors, for their works follow with them.
14.14: And I looked, and behold a white cloud, and on the cloud sat one like a son of man, having on his head a crown of gold and in his hand a sickle.
14.15: and another angel came out of the temple, crying with a loud voice to him who sat on the cloud, Put in your sickle and reap, for the time has come to reap, for the harvest of the earth has dried up.
14.16: And he who sat on the cloud put his sickle on the earth, and the earth was harvested.
14.17: And another angel came out of the temple in heaven, he also had a sickle.
14.18: And another angel [came out] from the altar, [who] had power over the fire, and spoke with a loud voice to the one who had the sickle, saying, Put your sickle and reap the grapes of the vine of the earth, for its grapes have flourished.
14.19: And the angel put his sickle into the earth, and plucked the vine of the earth, and put it into the winepress of the wrath of God the great.
14.20: and the sack was made outside the city, and blood came out of the sack from the bridles of the horses of a thousand and six hundred furlongs.

15.1: And I saw another sign in heaven, great and wonderful, seven angels having seven last plagues, for in them the wrath of God was fulfilled.
15.2: And I saw as it were a sea of ​​white mingled with fire, and those who overcome from the beast and from his image and from the number of his name, standing on the sea of ​​white, having the guitar of God.
15.3: And they will wear the robe of Moses the servant of God and the robe of the lamb, saying, Great and wonderful are your works, Lord God Almighty; just and true are your ways, King of the nations.
15.4: What will he not fear, sir, and glorify your name?  because you alone are holy, because all the nations will worship and worship before you, because your rights have been revealed.
15.5: And after this I saw, and the temple of the tabernacle in heaven was opened,
15.6: And the seven angels who had the seven plagues came out of the temple, clothed in pure bright linen and girded around their breasts with golden belts.
15.7: And one of the four living creatures gave to the seven angels seven golden vials filled with the wrath of the living God forever and ever.
15.8: And the temple was filled with smoke from the glory of God and from his power, and no one could enter the temple until the seven plagues of the seven angels were finished.

16.1: And I heard a loud voice from the temple saying to the seven angels, bring down and pour out the seven vials of God's wrath on the earth.
16.2: And the first one went out and poured out his vial on the ground, and a bad and wicked sore appeared on the people who had the mark of the beast and those who worshiped his image.
16.3: And the second poured out his flask into the sea, and there was blood as of a dead man, and every soul of life died in the sea.
16.4: And the third poured out his flask into the rivers and springs of water, and blood was produced.
16.5: And I heard the angel of the waters saying, Righteous art thou, who art and was, the holy one, for thou hast judged these things,
16.6: for they shed the blood of saints and prophets, and they drink blood; they are worthy.
16.7: And I heard the altar saying, Yes, Lord God Almighty, true and righteous are your judgments.
16.8: And the fourth held out his flask to the sun, and it was given to him to burn the people with fire.
16.9: And the people were greatly bruised, and they blasphemed the name of the god who has power over these wounds, and they did not repent, giving him glory.
16.10: And the fifth lifted up his vial upon the throne of the beast: and his kingdom was slain, and they chewed their tongues in pain,
16.11: And they blasphemed the God of heaven because of their pains and because of their sores, and they did not repent of their deeds.
16.12: And the sixth poured out his flask on the great river Euphrates, and its water dried up, so that the way of the kings of the east would be prepared.
16.13: And I saw out of the mouth of the dragon and out of the mouth of the beast and out of the mouth of the false prophet three unclean spirits like frogs;
16.14: for there are spirits of devils that cast signs, which come forth upon the kings of the whole world, to bring them to the war of the great day of God the Almighty.
16.15: Behold, I come as a thief.  blessed is he who hastens and keeps his clothes, so that he does not walk naked and they see his ugliness.
16.16: and brought them to the place called Hebraist Armageddon.
16.17: And the seventh lifted up his vial into the air: and a great voice came out of the temple from the throne saying, It is done.
16.18: And there were lightnings and voices and thunders, and there was a great earthquake, the like of which had not happened since a man had been on the earth until such a great earthquake.
16.19: And the great city was divided into three parts, and the cities of the nations fell.  And Babylon, the great memory before God, gives her the cup of the wine of the anger of his wrath.
16.20: And all the islands were gone, and no mountains were found.
16.21: And a great hailstorm descended from heaven upon the people, and the people blasphemed God from the plague of the hailstorm, because its plague was great and severe.

17.1: And there came one of the seven angels that had the seven vials, and spake unto me, saying, Deuro, show thee the pity of the great harlot that sitteth upon many waters,
17.2: with whom the kings of the earth committed fornication, and the inhabitants of the earth became drunk with the wine of her fornication.
17.3: And he sent me into the wilderness in spirit.  and I saw a woman sitting on a red beast, full of names of blasphemy, having seven heads and ten horns.
17.4: and the woman was clothed in purple and scarlet, and gilded with gold and precious stones and pearls, I had a golden cup in her hand full of abominations and the unclean things of her fornication,
17.5: and on her forehead a name written, a mystery, Babylon the great, the mother of harlots and abominations of the earth.
17.6: and I saw the woman drunk from the blood of the saints and from the blood of the martyrs of Jesus.  And I marveled when I saw this great miracle.
17.7: And the angel said to me, Why did you wonder?  I will tell you the mystery of the woman and the beast that sat on her, the one that has the seven heads and the ten horns;
17.8: the beast that you saw was and is not, and is coming to ascend from the abyss, and to perish; and those who dwell on the earth, whose name is not written in the book of life from the foundation of the world, will be amazed, seeing the beast that was and is not and is present.
17.9: here is the mind that has wisdom.  the seven heads are seven mountains, where the woman sits on them.  and there are seven kings;
17.10: the five have fallen, one is here, the other has not come, and when he comes, he stays for a while.
17.11: and the beast that was and is not, and he is the eighth and is of the seven, and he perishes.
17.12: and the ten horns that you saw are ten kings, who did not receive a kingdom, but they receive power as kings for an hour with the beast.
17.13: these have one opinion, and they give their power and authority to the beast.
17.14: these shall fight with the lamb, and the lamb shall overcome them, for he is lord of lords and king of kings, and those with him are called and chosen and faithful.
17.15: And he says to me, The waters you saw, where the harlot sits, are peoples and multitudes and nations and languages.
17.16: and the ten horns that you saw and the beast, these shall hate the harlot, and shall make her desolate and naked, and her flesh shall be eaten, and shall burn her with fire;
17.17: for God has put into their hearts to do His opinion, and if you do one opinion, he will give their kingdom to the beast, until the words of God are fulfilled.
17.18: And the woman whom you saw is the city, the great one, who reigned over the kings of the earth.

18.1: After this I saw another angel coming down from heaven, having great power, and the earth was illuminated by his glory.
18.2: And he cried out with a loud voice, saying, Babylon the great is fallen, fallen, and became the dwelling place of demons and the prison of every unclean spirit and the prison of every unclean beauty [and the prison of every unclean beast] and hateful,
18.3: for from the wine of the wrath of her fornication all the nations drank, and the kings of the earth with her committed fornication, and the merchants of the earth grew rich from the power of her bed.
18.4: And I heard another voice from heaven saying, Come out, my people, from her, so that you do not share in her sins, and from her wounds so that you do not receive;
18.5: because her sins stuck to heaven, and God remembered her crimes.
18.6: Recompense her as she has repaid, and double her double according to her deeds; in the cup she drank, you gave her double.
18.7: As much as he glorified her and strangled her, give her as much torment and mourning.  because in her heart she says that I sit as a queen, and I am not a widow, and I see no mourning;
18.8: therefore in one day her plagues shall be great, death and mourning and famine, and she shall be consumed in fire; for God is a mighty lord who has given her lily.
18.9: And the kings of the earth who committed fornication and fornication with her will weep and cut themselves over her, when they see the smoke of her burning,
18.10: They stood afar off for fear of her torment, saying, Oh, oh, oh, oh, the great city, Babylon, the mighty city, for in an hour your judgment has come.
18.11: And the merchants of the land weep and mourn over her, because no one buys their yoke,
18.12: a yoke of gold, and of silver, and of precious stones, and of pearls, of crimson, and of purple, and of purple, and of scarlet;
18.13: and cinnamon, and frankincense, and frankincense, and myrrh, and frankincense, and wine, and oil, and seed, and wheat, and beasts, and sheep, and horses, and yokes, and bodies, and souls of men.
18.14: and your fruit of the soul's desire is gone from you, and all the fat and the bright things are lost from you, and nothing will be found.
18.15: the merchants of these, those who have become rich from her, stand from afar for fear of her torment, weeping and mourning,
18.16: saying, Oh, oh, the great city, the one covered with crimson and purple and scarlet, and gilded [in] gold and precious stones and pearls,
18.17: because for a time so much wealth was deserted.  And every captain and every one in the place of the sea and the sailors and those who work the sea from afar set
18.18: And they cried out when they saw the smoke of this burning, saying, What is the likeness of the great city?
18.19: And they put them on their heads and cried out, weeping and mourning, saying, Oh, oh, the great city, in which all those who had ships in the sea became rich from its honor, because it was deserted for an hour.
18.20: Rejoice over her, O heavens, and the saints and the apostles and the prophets, because God has judged your shame from her.
18.21: And there was an angel, strong as a millstone, and he cast it into the sea, saying, Thus shall Babylon the great city be seen rushing, and no year shall be found.
18.22: and the voice of the harpers and musicians and courtiers and trumpeters shall not be heard in you for a year, and every craftsman of every art shall not be found in you for a year, and the voice of a mill shall not be heard in you for a year,
18.23: and the light of a lamp shall not be seen in thee for a year, and the voice of bridegroom and bridegroom shall not be heard in thee for a year; for thy merchants were the great men of the earth, for in thy pharmacy all the nations were led astray,
18.24: and in it was found the blood of prophets and saints and of all those slain on earth.

19.1: After these things I heard as it were the voice of a great multitude in heaven, saying, Alleluia, the salvation and the glory and the power of our God,
19.2: that his judgments are true and just; that he judged the great harlot who corrupted the earth in her fornication, and avenged the blood of his servants at her hand.
19.3: and secondly they shouted, Hallelujah, and the smoke of it goes up to the ages of the ages.
19.4: And the twenty-four elders and the four beasts fell down, and worshiped God who sat on the throne, saying, Amen, Hallelujah.
19.5: And a voice came from the throne saying, Praise our God, all his servants, [and] those who fear him, the small and the great.
19.6: And I heard as the voice of a great multitude and as the voice of many waters and as the voice of mighty thunders saying, Alleluia, for the Lord [our] God Almighty has reigned.
19.7: let us rejoice and be glad, and give him the glory, for the marriage of the lamb has come, and his wife has made herself ready;
19.8: And it was given to her to surround herself with a bright, pure crimson, for the crimson is the rights of the saints.
19.9: And he says to me, Write: Blessed are those who are invited to the marriage supper of the Lamb.  and he says to me, These are the true words of God.
19.10: And I fell before his feet to worship him.  And he says to me, "Don't wait. I am your servant and your brothers who have the testimony of Jesus. Worship God."  because the testimony of Jesus is the spirit of prophecy.
19.11: And I saw the heaven opened, and behold a white horse, and he who sat on it [called] faithful and true, and in righteousness he judges and fights.
19.12: and his eyes [like] a flame of fire, and on his head many diadems, having a name written which no one has seen but him,
19.13: and clothed with a garment covered with blood, and his name is called the word of God.
19.14: and the armies in heaven followed him on white horses, clothed in pure crimson white.
19.15: and out of his mouth goeth fiery poison, that he may smite the nations with it, and he shepherdeth them with a rod of iron: and he treadeth the winepress of the wrath of the wrath of God Almighty.
19.16: and he has a name written on his garment and on his thigh: King of kings and Lord of lords.
19.17: And I saw an angel standing in the sun, and he cried [in] a loud voice, saying to all the eagles, to those thrown in the middle of the net, Behold, come together to the great supper of God,
19.18: that ye may eat the flesh of kings, and the flesh of captains, and the flesh of mighty men, and the flesh of horses, and of them that sit upon them, and the flesh of all free men, and servants, both small and great.
19.19: And I saw the beast and the kings of the earth and their armies gathered together to make war with the one sitting on the horse and with his army.
19.20: And the beast was seized, and with him the false prophet who performed the signs before him, in which he deceived those who received the mark of the beast and those who worshiped his image.
19.21: and the rest fell into the mouth of the one sitting on the horse, and all the vultures were fed from their flesh.

20.1: And I saw an angel coming down from heaven, having the key of the abyss and a great chain in his hand.
20.2: And he restrained the dragon, Ophis the Ancient, who is the Devil and Satan, and bound him a thousand years,
20.3: and he put him in the abyss and closed and sealed him so that he would not lead the nations astray until the thousand years were over; after this he was released for a short time.
20.4: And I saw thrones, and they sat on them, and pity was given to them, and the souls of those who were crushed because of the testimony of Jesus and because of the word of God, and who did not worship the beast or his image and did not receive the mark on their foreheads and on their hands; and they lived. they reigned with Christ for a thousand years.
20.5: the rest of the dead did not live until the thousand years were over.  This is the first resurrection.
20.6: blessed and holy is he who has part in the first resurrection; over these the second death has no power, but they are priests of God and of Christ, and they will reign with him [the] thousand years.
20.7: And when the thousand years are over, Satan will be released from his prison,
20.8: and the nations go forth astray in the four corners of the earth, Gog and Magog, bring them to war, where their number is like the sand of the sea.
20.9: and they went up to the breadth of the earth and surrounded the intercession of the saints and the beloved city.  and fire came down from heaven and devoured them;
20.10: and the devil who seduced them was cast into the lake of fire and brimstone, where both the beast and the false prophet will be tormented day and night forever and ever.
20.11: And I saw a great white throne and one sitting on it, from whose face the earth and the sky departed, and no place was found for them.
20.12: and I saw the dead, the great and the small, standing before the throne, and books were opened; and another book was opened, which is of life; and the dead were judged from those written in the books according to their works.
20.13: And the sea gave up the dead in it, and death and Hades gave up the dead in them, and each was judged according to their works.
20.14: And death and Hades were thrown into the lake of fire.  this is the second death, the lake of fire.
20.15: And if they were not found written in the book of life, he was cast into the lake of fire.

21.1: And I saw a new heaven and a new earth: for the first heaven and the first earth passed away, and the sea is not a year.
21.2: and I saw the holy city Jerusalem again, coming down from heaven from God, prepared as a bride adorned for her husband.
21.3: And I heard a great voice from the throne saying, Behold the tabernacle of God with men, and he shall tabernacle with them, and these shall be his people, and this god shall be with them, [their god,]
21.4: and he will wipe away every tear from their eyes, and death will be no more, neither mourning nor crying nor pain will be no more; [that] the first things have come to pass.
21.5: And he who sat on the throne said, Behold, I am making all things new.  And he says, Write, because these words are faithful and true.
21.6: And they said to me, They happened.  I am the Alpha and the Omega, the beginning and the end.  I will give to the thirsty from the fountain of the water of life for free.
21.7: he who conquers shall inherit these, and I will be his god and he shall be my son.
21.8: but to the cowardly, and unbelieving, and abominable, and slaying, and harlots, and druggists, and idolaters, and to all liars, let their part be in the lake of burning fire and brimstone, which is the second death.
21.9: And there came one of the seven angels who had the seven vials, those who had the seven last plagues, and spoke to me saying, Deuro, show you the nymph the lamb's wife.
21.10: And he carried me up in spirit to a great and high mountain, and showed me the city, the holy Jerusalem, coming down from heaven from God,
21.11: they had the glory of God; her fosterer was like a stone of honor, like a crystallizing jasper stone;
21.12: I had a great and high wall, I had twelve pillars, and on the gates twelve angels, and names were inscribed, which are [the names] of the twelve tribes of the sons of Israel.
21.13: from the east three pillars, and from the north three pillars, and from the south three pillars, and from the west three pillars;
21.14: and the wall of the city has twelve foundations, and on them twelve names of the twelve apostles of the lamb.
21.15: And he that spoke with me had a measure of gold reeds, to measure the city and its pillars and its wall.
21.16: And the city is square, and its length as [and] its width.  And they measured the city with the reed at twelve thousand furlongs: its length and breadth and height are equal.
21.17: and they measured its wall one hundred and forty-four cubits, the measure of a man, which is of an angel.
21.18: and the building of its wall is jasper, and the city of pure gold, like clear glass.
21.19: the foundations of the wall of the city all adorned with precious stones: the foundation the first jasper, the second sapphire, the third chalcedony, the fourth emerald,
21.20: the fifth sardonyx, the sixth sardion, the seventh chrysolite, the eighth beryl, the ninth topazion, the tenth chrysopraso, the eleventh hyacinth, the twelfth amethyst.
21.21: and the twelve pillars were twelve pearls, on each of the pillars was a pearl.  and the square of the city of gold, pure as clear glass.
21.22: And I did not see a temple in it, because the Lord God Almighty is its temple, and the lamb.
21.23: and the city has no need of the sun or the moon to shine upon it, for the glory of God has illumined it, and its lamp the lamb.
21.24: and the nations shall walk by its light; and the kings of the earth shall bring their glory into it;
21.25: and its gates shall not be closed by day, for there is no night there;
21.26: and let the glory and honor of the nations be in it.
21.27: And there shall not enter into it any common man, nor [the] whose abomination and falsehood, except those written in the Lamb's book of life.

22.1: And they showed me a river of water of life bright as crystal, proceeding from the throne of God and of the lamb.
22.2: in the middle of this square and the river here and there a tree of life bears twelve fruits, every month they give its fruit, and the leaves of the tree for the healing of the nations.
22.3: and every inventory is not a year.  and the throne of God and of the Lamb shall be in it, and his servants shall worship him,
22.4: and they see his face, and his name on their foreheads.
22.5: And there will be no night, and they will not need the light of a lamp or the light of the sun, because the Lord God will shine upon them, and they will reign forever and ever.
22.6: And he said to me, These words are faithful and true, and the Lord, the God of the spirits of the prophets, sent his angel to show his servants what he sees happening in the future.
22.7: and behold, I come quickly.  blessed is he who keeps the words of the prophecy of this book.
22.8: And John hears and sees these things.  And when I heard and saw, I fell prostrate before the feet of the angel who showed me these things.
22.9: And he says to me, "Don't wait; I am a servant of you and of your brothers the prophets and those who keep the words of this book; worship God."
22.10: and he says to me, Do not seal up the words of the prophecy of this book, for the time is near.
22.11: Let the unjust do injustice, and let the scoundrel repent, and the righteous do justice, and let the holy be sanctified.
22.12: Behold, I come quickly, and my wages with me, to each one according to his work.
22.13: I am the Alpha and the Sky, the first and the last, the beginning and the end.
22.14: Blessed are they that wash their garments, that their power may be upon the tree of life, and at the gates they may enter into the city.
22.15: out the dogs and the druggists and the prostitutes and the murderers and the idolaters and every friend and whose lies.
22.16: I, Jesus, sent my angel to testify these things to you in the churches.  I am the root and the genus David, the bright morning star.
22.17: And the spirit and the nymph say, Come.  and he that heareth I say, Come.  and the thirsty will come, and the thirsty will receive the water of life freely.
22.18: I testify to everyone who hears the words of the prophecy of this book: if he applies them to them, may God apply to him the plagues written in this book;
22.19: and if he removes them from the words of the book of this prophecy, God removes his part from the tree of life and from the holy city, written in this book.
22.20: He who testifies to these things says, Yes, I am coming quickly.  Amen, come, Lord Jesus.
22.21: The grace of the Lord Jesus after all.
